Row.Text: Go on Hajj to the Holy City
Going on a pilgrimage is one of the pillars of Islam, and this is something every able bodied Muslim is expected to do once in his life.[NEWLINE]
Perform a Purification Ritual
The sacred waters of the five rivers can purify us and make us ready to perform sacrifice. Let us cleanse our bodies so that we may honor the gods.[NEWLINE]
Honour the Exalted Cranes
We shhould carve idols and pray for the blessing of Al-Lat, Al-Uzza, and Al-Manat; the exalted goddesses whose intercession is hoped for.[NEWLINE]
Sleep in the Royal Tombs
By sleeping on the tombs of our ancestors, they may visit us in our dreams and impart prophecy to aid our kingdom and community.[NEWLINE]
Go on a Great Hunt

The angakkuq has returned from the world of the spirits and Sedna has promised to make the oceans plentiful. Let us embark on a great hunt to bring food and comfort to our people, and afterwards let us give thanks to the whale spirit for allowing us the hunt.[NEWLINE]
Celebrate the Kadayawan Festival

The Kadaywan is a weeklong celebration of the harvest, in which we come together as a community to give thanks to Bathala. Let us prepare for the festivities as our citizens dress in costume to sing and dance and set up arenas to watch the horse fights.[NEWLINE]
Write a Confession of Faith

Our churches have a long history of composing Confessions of Faith; formal declarations of belief. Though many serve as theses for debate, others seek unity between groups on controversial doctrines. Let us draft our own Confession in an effort to formalize doctrinal standards.[NEWLINE]
Appoint Church Leaders
The church lacks men to lead it. We are in a position to correct this. Let us aid the church in seeking out wise and godly men to appoint as the leaders of Arianism![NEWLINE]
Construct Horns of Consecration
Let us construct an altar modeled from the horns of sacrificial oxen so that we may honor the gods and give libation.[NEWLINE]
Celebrate a Royal Jubilee
Great Pharaoh, the time has come to hold a royal jubilee and renew your divine right of kingship. Let us race the Apis bull and offer sacrifice to Aten.[NEWLINE]
Celebrate the Akitu

A new half year has begun and your subjects are already preparing a festival to celebrate the sowing of the barley. Let us move the statue of Ashur from the great house and honour his victory of Tiamat, renewing our great city and asking Ashur's blessings for the coming year.[NEWLINE]
Perform the Nineteen Day Fast

The Nineteen Day Fast was instituted by Bahá'u'lláh. Bringing together the community, it represents a period of meditation and prayer during which the believer must strive to make the necessary readjustments in his inner life and to refresh and reinvigorate his soul.[NEWLINE]
Appoint Church Leaders
The church lacks men to lead it. We are in a position to correct this. Let us aid the church in seeking out wise and godly men to appoint as the leaders of Christianity![NEWLINE]
Perform a Fertility Rite
We mold the woman into the shape of a bird, the shape of a snake, the shape of a frog. Just as the woman gives birth to the wheat and the quince, we ask the woman to give birth to a son.[NEWLINE]
Elect Teachers
St. Paul taught us that simpleminded men should instruct one another. Therefore, we pray in private houses and elect teachers from amongst our congregation to be our spiritual guides.[NEWLINE]
Perform Lubuko
Only through divining the will of our ancestors can we hope to avoid misfortune. Let the nsengha drink mwavi and enter the realm of dreams in order to learn the will of the bankambo.[NEWLINE]
Appoint Church Leaders
The church lacks men to lead it. We are in a position to correct this. Let us aid the church in seeking out wise and godly men to appoint as the leaders of the Cathars![NEWLINE]
Perform the El Dorado Ceremony
You must renew your kingship and be recognized by the tribal chiefs! Come, be anointed in gold as you journey to the great lagoon and make votive offerings to the gods.[NEWLINE]
Celebrate the Ziyarat al-Nabi Shu'ayb
Let us make a pilgrimage to the shrine of the Prophet Shu'ayb. Shu'ayb is the chief prophet of the Druze religion to whom God passed on his revelation directly before passing it on to Moses.[NEWLINE]
Hold the Raan Festival
After the first new moon, we prepare the sacred shrines and holy places and make offerings of millet and milk to our ancestors.[NEWLINE]
Perform a Theurgic Ritual
By performing the ritual acts and identifying the divine sumbolon, the vehicle of our souls can align with the divine hierarchy and theurgic union can be achieved.[NEWLINE]
Create a Hand of Sabazios

A Hand of Sabazios is a bronze ritual hand used to adorn altars and carried during religious processions. On its palm and fingers we cast details of our rider god, Sabazios, and his great hunt.[NEWLINE]
Appoint Church Leaders
The church lacks men to lead it. We are in a position to correct this. Let us aid the church in seeking out wise and godly men to appoint as the leaders of the Hussites![NEWLINE]
Pronounce Apotheosis
Your honorable father has passed! Let the senate vote and elevate him to the rank of god so that we may better our lineage and strengthen imperial authority.[NEWLINE]
Celebrate the Inti Raymi

The winter solstice is fast approaching and already your subjects have begun to organize dances and processions for the festival. We should prepare sacrifice for Inti and Pachamama to ensure a good harvest in the coming season.[NEWLINE]
Celebrate the Mahavir Jayanti

Mahavir Jayanti is our most important holiday. During the festival we celebrate the birth of Mahavira; the twenty fourth and last Tirthankara. Let us prepare the rath yatra and carry the image of Mahavira through our cities on a chariot.[NEWLINE]
Create a Kachina Doll
Our people strive for a closer connection to their ancestors. Let us create a vessel for the spirits, to protect us and provide good fortune in the coming season.[NEWLINE]
Perform a Cattle Sacrifice
Ngai has blessed us with rain and the grass has grown tall to feed our cattle! Let the laiboni offer sacrifice to give thanks and honor Ngai's gift.[NEWLINE]
Hold the Autumn Festival
Our subjects eagerly await the Autumn Festival. Let us don our animal masks and lead a procession to the mound temple so that we may offer sacrifice to the three gods.[NEWLINE]
Baptize the Faithful
Baptism helps cleanse the material evil of the body, redeeming our soul and bringing it closer to salvation.[NEWLINE]
Commemorate the Prophet
The prophet Mani offered us a vision of spiritual light of the world overcoming material darkness. We take a day to remember him and commemorate his birth as we read Manichaean scripture.[NEWLINE]
Hold the Midwinter Festival

The first new moon of the year symbolizes a time to give thanks to the spirits and renew our connection with nature. Let us stir the ashes of our hearths and have the midew cleanse the village before holding a great feast in honour of Nanabozho.[NEWLINE]
Construct a Mithraeum
A great cave lies in the mountains to our east. We should convert it into the image of the universe so that we may initiate others into the mysteries and hold our cultic meal.[NEWLINE]
Call the Gathering
Let the hierophants declare prorrhesis and perform sacrifice, as the initiates hold their night vigil and drink barley and kykeon.[NEWLINE]
Celebrate Pioneer Day
On this day we celebrate our brothers and sisters who first settled these lands after being forced from their homes. Let us hold parades and other festivities to help commemorate the event.[NEWLINE]
Perform a Bear Sacrifice
The end of winter approaches. Let us capture a newborn bear cub so that we may send it off to the world of the gods.[NEWLINE]
Go on Hajj to the Holy City
Going on a pilgrimage is one of the pillars of Islam, and this is something every able bodied Muslim is expected to do once in his life.[NEWLINE]
Perform a Kraal Sacrifice
Our sangoma fear that the amadholozi have grown displeased with our actions. We should sacrifice cattle in the umsamo of our chief to help placate and honour our ancestors.[NEWLINE]
Celebrate the Akitu

A new half year has begun and your subjects are already preparing a festival to celebrate the sowing of the barley. Let us move the statue of Kiririsha from the great house to the sea, renewing our great city and asking Kiririsha's blessings for the coming year.[NEWLINE]
Perform a Theurgic Ritual
By performing the ritual acts and identifying the divine sumbolon, the vehicle of our souls can align with the divine hierarchy and theurgic union can be achieved.[NEWLINE]
Perform a Healing Dance
Tell the healers to prepare the night dance to aid our community. Let them tie the offerings to the trees and bang their drums to contact the spirits of our ancestors.[NEWLINE]
Perform Haruspicy
Let us sacrifice a newborn sheep and examine its liver for omens so that we may better discern the will of the gods.[NEWLINE]
Create an Ikenga
Our people strive for a closer connection to their ancestors. Let us create a vessel for the spirits, to protect us and provide good fortune in the coming season.[NEWLINE]
Hold the Yam Festival

The Yam Festival is a five day feast marking the first yam harvest following the monsoon season. It is a time for us to thank Nyame and the spirits of our ancestors as we come together in peace and community.[NEWLINE]
Collect Medicinal Herbs

A sickness is spreading through our empire and the paje inform us that a malevolent spirit is attacking the souls of the poor. We need to collect a new supply of sacred herbs so that the paje may enter the spirit world and combat this evil.[NEWLINE]
Celebrate Makahiki

The Makahiki season has arrived and our warriors put down their spears to celebrate the new year. Let our priests offer ho'okupu to Lono, as our people feast and wrestle to prove their strength.[NEWLINE]
Celebrate Makahiki

The Makahiki season has arrived and our warriors put down their spears to celebrate the new year. Let our priests offer ho'okupu to Lono, as our people feast and wrestle to prove their strength.[NEWLINE]
Perform the Turning of the Bones

The spirits of the dead only join the world of the ancestors after their bodies fully decompose. We must observe the famadihana tradition and exhume our ancestors so that we may rewrap them in fresh cloth. By marking the occasion with song and dance we bring together the spirits of the living and the dead and grow as a community.[NEWLINE]
Hold a Rozhanitsy Meal
At the end of year we invoke the great god Rod to honor mothers and midwives and ensure the birth of strong sons in the following season.[NEWLINE]
Hold a Kurgan Burial
A great hero has died! Let us build a great barrow and fill his burial chamber with gold as we sacrifice a horse to honor his spirit.[NEWLINE]
Perform a Bear Sacrifice
The end of winter approaches. Let us capture a newborn bear cub so that we may send it off to the world of the gods.[NEWLINE]
Obtain the Elekes

In order to be initiated into the faith, we must receive the protection and blessing of the Orichas. We must receive the colored beads of Elegua, Obatala, Yemaya, Chango, and Ochun and fasten a necklace to be bathed in blood.[NEWLINE]
Conduct a Baci Ceremony

Through the Baci we synchronize the thirty-two components of the soul. By observing the ritual we can establish social and familial bonds to maintain the balance and harmony of the individual and community.[NEWLINE]
Carve a Transformation Mask

Masks play an important role in our religious ceremonies; displaying the crest of our ancestors and their relationship with the spirits of nature. When we wear the mask with song and dance, we transform into the animal spirit and call upon our ancestors for help and guidance.[NEWLINE]
Perform a Lingam Offering
The lingam represents the great Shiva. Let us prepare the lingam as well as the yoni of his consort and pour offerings of milk and ghee.[NEWLINE]
Celebrate the Akitu

A new half year has begun and your subjects are already preparing a festival to celebrate the sowing of the barley. Let us move the statute of Anu from the great house and honour his victory of Nammu, renewing our great city and asking Anu's blessings for the coming year.[NEWLINE]
Hold a Rozhanitsy Meal
At the end of year we invoke the great god Rod to honor mothers and midwives and ensure the birth of strong sons in the following season.[NEWLINE]
Hold the Green Corn Ceremony

The time of the summer harvest is fast approaching. As our priests prepare to sacrifice the first of the green corn to give thanks and ensure the yearly crop, let us catch game and rehearse the feather dance so that our people may celebrate the coming season.[NEWLINE]
Hold a Hain Ceremony

Our children have become men and it is time to initiate them into the traditions and secrets of our people. Let them paint their bodies and train in the ways of the spirits as we hold a hain ceremony to mark the occasion.[NEWLINE]
Hold an Initiation Ceremony

A few of our youth have reached the aged of manhood. Let the elders take them into the bush and teach them the sacred songs and dances of the dreaming before they are painted with white ochre and circumcised so that they may be accepted as warriors.[NEWLINE]
Hold the Festival of Chicckaban

During the month of Xul we hold a festival dedicated to the great Feathered Serpent. Let us burn incense and bring offerings to the temples so that Kulkulcan may descend from the heavens and collect his sacrifice.[NEWLINE]
Perform a Fire Sacrifice
The sacrifice is an act of cosmic renewal. Through Agni, the sacrificial fire, we destroy an object in the world of man so that we may renew that object in the world of the gods.[NEWLINE]
Draw a Veve
Great Houngan, we must prepare for the coming ritual. Let us draw the veve on the floor with red brick powder so that the Loas may descend to earth.[NEWLINE]
Hold the Feast of the Assembly

Once a year we hold a seven day festival to reaffirm our community and sense of identity. During this time, all able bodied Yazidi should endeavor to make a pilgrimage to the tomb of Sheikh Adi ibn Musafir in Lalis where we sacrifice an ox to mark the end of summer.[NEWLINE]
Create a Zemi
Our people strive for a closer connection to their ancestors. Let us create a vessel for the spirits, to protect us and provide good fortune in the coming season.[NEWLINE]
Hold a Malanggan Ceremony

The Malanggan is a ceremony where we come together as a village to honour our dead by repaying our debts and obligations to one another. Let us carve totems and masks for the recently departed; burning these icons or leaving them in caves to ensure a good hunt and harvest.[NEWLINE]
Perform the Kampa Ritual

Rak, the season of plenty, is upon us and it is time to reaffirm our dedication to the gods and spirits of this land. Let us put away the yams and taro and offer breadfruit so that we may find favor and ensure that our nets will always be bountiful.[NEWLINE]
Esotericism
Sufism
Kabbalah
Apophatic Theology
Hesychasm
Orphism
Neidan
Ifá
Yoga
Seidhr
Medicine Society
Muti
Xinxue
Pentecostalism
New Age Movement

A new mystic tradition has begun to develop among our religious elite. Adopting some of these ideas into mainstream belief would likely give us a greater understanding of our faith, but may also make it more inaccessible to outsiders.

An interdenominational renewal movement has begun to take hold in our church. Encouraging this development may spark a new found enthusiasm in our faith, but may also decrease the unity of our greater communion.

A New Age religious movement has emerged in our cities. Promoting its message of universal peace and love could increase our popularity among youth groups, but would likely be met with opposition by established church leaders.
Let us explore the secrets of our faith.
Let us celebrate our personal connection to the Holy Spirit.
Let us enter the Age of Aquarius!

[ICON_BULLET][COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]Your Cities will produce 20% less Religious Pressure[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+1 [ICON_PEACE] Faith for every 5 [ICON_CITIZEN] Citizens in your Cities[ENDCOLOR]
These ideas are dangerous to the uninitiated!
This movement doesn't interest us.
They're just a bunch of hippies...
[ICON_BULLET][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+1 [ICON_PEACE] Faith per City[ENDCOLOR]
A new mystic tradition has emerged!
A renewal movement has spread through our church!
The Age of Aquarius has begun!
Spiritualism
A growing interest in the spirit world has taken hold in your cities as your educated elite attempt to use emerging sciences to prove the existence of an afterlife.
The spirits will guide us!
[ICON_BULLET][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Religious Buildings will also provide +2 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science[ENDCOLOR]
Your citizens are attempting to contact the spirit world!
Rosicrucian Enlightenment

Anonymous manifestos have begun to circulate among the educated elite of your cities declaring the existence of a secret brotherhood of alchemists and sages who are preparing to transform religion, the arts and sciences, and the political landscape. While tales of the mysterious Christian Rosenkreuz and his fabled Chemical Wedding are confusing much of your populace, others see it as a call to arms to form an Invisible College and further the emerging sciences.
The manifestos are an allegory of our faith.
[ICON_BULLET][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Gain [ICON_PEACE] Faith equal to the amount of [ICON_PEACE] Faith needed to spawn your next Great Prophet ({1_Award} [ICON_PEACE] Faith)[ENDCOLOR]
The manifestos are a model for emerging sciences.
[ICON_BULLET][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Gain [ICON_RESEARCH] Science equal to half the amount of [ICON_PEACE] Faith needed to spawn your next Great Prophet ({1_Award} [ICON_RESEARCH] Science)[ENDCOLOR]
Rosicrucianism has provided your citizens with new insights into their faith!
Rosicrucianism has inspired your citizens to form an Invisible College!
Revelation

While observing your kingdom a great light appears to break through the clouds before slowly moving in the direction of a nearby mountain. None of your advisors can claim to have witnessed the event, but you are convinced it held some meaning.
This must be a sign from the heavens!
[ICON_BULLET][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]+{1_Award} [ICON_PEACE] Faith[ENDCOLOR]
You have received a message from the heavens!
Atheism
Advances in science and technology have led many of your citizens to question religious truths and even the existence of God.
This is a sign of the times...
[ICON_BULLET][COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]Your Cities will randomly lose religious followers[ENDCOLOR]
Your citizens have begun to question the existence of God!
The Rapture

Citizens all across your empire have mysteriously vanished leaving nothing behind but their clothes. The scientific community is baffled while religious leaders are claiming that the missing population ascended into heaven.
I guess we were left behind...
[ICON_BULLET][COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]Lose 1 to 3 [ICON_CITIZEN] Population in all Cities[ENDCOLOR]
Citizens across your empire have mysteriously vanished!
Millenarianism
The approaching millennium has caused a minor panic among your citizens, many of whom are convinced the world is going to end.
They must be joking... right?

[ICON_BULLET][COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]50% chance to suffer [ICON_RESISTANCE] Anarchy after you reach the year AD {1_Date}[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]50% chance to enter a minor [ICON_GOLDEN_AGE] Golden Age after you reach the year AD {1_Date}[ENDCOLOR]
Your citizens are convinced the world is going to end!
HR Dummy
HR Dummy
+1 [ICON_PEACE] Faith per City
HR Dummy
Cities produce 25% less Religious Pressure.
This building cannot be constructed.

Esotericism refers to a wide array of ideas and movements which have developed within Western society, and which have remained largely distinct from both orthodox Judeo-Christian religion and Enlightenment rationalism. A trans-disciplinary field, esotericism has pervaded various forms of Western philosophy, religion, pseudoscience, art, literature, and music, continuing to have an impact on intellectual ideas and popular culture.
HR Dummy
HR Dummy
+1 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science from Religious Buildings
